Steps.Message: Good afternoon, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 20th of February 2026 in the RH13 postcode area. Our engineers have advised us that the 9 affected properties will be restored early between approximately 12:45-13:00 as the works have progressed well. We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works for a third party to trim trees around our overhead cables on Worthing Road will be completed which will adhere to the customer request and reduce the risk of you having a tree related unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-97938-V. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript:
This work is taking place near Mimms Lane. We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine
a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps
to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power
cuts in the future.
To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your
electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to
cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network
in the future.

This work is taking place on Scabharbour Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place along Crowhurst Lane.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Sam at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is in progress today the 20th of February 2026 in the IP30 postcode area. The power was switched off at 09:00 to enable our engineers to safely carry out tree trimming around our overhead electricity cables in the Eastlow Hill area. Our engineers have advised us that the 67 affected properties will be restored early by approx. 12:00 due to the works being completed earlier than planned. Now these works have been completed, this will improve the reliability of the electricity network and reduce the risk of a tree related unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-24606-O. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105. VB & SMS sent.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 09:00. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

Sent by Adam at 10:49 - We can now confirm that all power in the area should be back on. Our engineers had to unexpectedly turn off the power to safely repair an underground cable which had been damaged by a third party in the Dean Close area.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our tree trimming team are still clearing the foliage from around the overhead cables in the Ipswich IP8 3 area.

With darkness now upon us we understand that it can be unsettling to have a power cut. It may help to locate a torch and anything else you may need so you can have it to hand just in case.

If you have any concerns please do not hesitate to contact our team, but we will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible. Sent by Donny at 17:15.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that there is still extensive tree trimming required on site in order to then check the overhead cabling for any necessary repairs.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 17:30 and 18:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Donny at 15:58.

Steps.Message:
Hello, Donny from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers have worked to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have arrived on site in the RH10 6 area to investigate the power cut affecting 284 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Theo at 05:04.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Luke at 08:42 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Our engineers have let us know that more resources have arrived but it is taking longer to investigate the cause and restore power. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 12:30 and 13:30

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

Sent by Luke at 08:07 - Our engineers are still working on site and we have more on their way to assist. We are still aiming to have all power back on between 08:30 and 09:30.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.

Sent by Aaron at 06:13 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Thanks for your continued patience today. We know a power cut is disruptive, especially with so many people currently working at home. We appreciate this is an added concern, so we want to provide some advice for anyone in this situation.

You can use your phone as a personal hotspot to keep an internet connection (be aware of the data limit your network provider allows for this), use a battery pack to keep your devices charged and adjust the power settings on any laptops or mobile devices to extend their lifespan. As it's quite common for your immediate neighbours to remain on power during an issue like this, ask to see if they can share access to their Wi-Fi network temporarily.

We'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We know there have been previous power cuts this year, but following network tests made by our engineers today we do not believe they are related. We'll continue to monitor the situation closely however.

Sent by Aaron at 10:09 - We can now confirm that all power in the Wykeham Way area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Wykeham Way area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 12:00 and 13:00; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Aaron at 09:23.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 11:51 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Engineers have arrived on site to investigate what we believe to be an issue at the local substation in the Friarage Road area. Using an average timescale for this type of issue, we're looking to have you back on between 15:00 and 16:00, however we must stress that this time may change, depending on what our staff find. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but for more information about this type of fault; here's a short YouTube video https://UKPN.short.gy/fuse. Sent by Aaron at 11:43.

Sent by Aaron at 12:48 - We can now confirm that all power in the Sussex Street area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Aaron at 11:47.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Sussex Street area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Logs.Comment:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that investigations and repair work are ongoing in The Roystons area.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame for these to continue, so we're now working towards between 23:30-00:30 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Donny at 20:42.

Sent by Donny at 19:17 -

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 18:41 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Steeles Road area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible. Further investigations will be carried out.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 18:25 - Our staff have now managed to restore power back to the Highcliffe Drive SW15 4 area again.

They have thoroughly investigated our network equipment in the area, but the underlying network fault has not yet developed to a point for it to appear on any of their diagnostic tests. As such, they have replaced our substation equipment to restore power as quickly as possible.

I'm sorry this affected your power again today. This may happen again before we're able to pinpoint the issue and fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about anything or if your power isn't on, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again.

We believe there may be an underlying issue causing the recent power cuts, but due to the nature of the electricity network, the heat created by a developing fault can cause a break in a cable to reseal itself. This can make it difficult to locate, so while our engineers are testing our equipment thoroughly to pinpoint the issue, this kind of problem may interrupt power multiple times before it's possible for us to fix.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

I'll keep you updated. Sent by Decasta at 18:02
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Highcliffe Drive SW15 4 area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 20:00-21:00 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Decasta at 17:30.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We were investigating a high voltage overhead electricity line fault which caused a power cut in the local area.

Logs.Comment:
Sent by Roland at 18:29 - Our engineers have restored power to all 885 properties in the Buntingford SG9 area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an overhead cable fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.

Our engineers have arrived on site in the Buntingford SG9 area to investigate the power cut affecting 280 properties.

Specialist engineers are also working to divert power remotely, and this can cause your lights to go on and off.

We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. Sent by Roland at 17:47.

What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Limpsfield Road area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to be testing if the network is still healthy.

They will start at the substation, and often apply specialist equipment that may turn your power back on for a brief period, so don't worry if your power comes on and goes off again. They will also check smaller sites which run along our cabling route, these break our network down into smaller sections and can help pinpoint any possible problems.

Our estimated time frame of 22:00-23:00 hasn't changed, so I'll let you know more once our staff update us. Sent by Bev at 18:28.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Donny at 18:20 - Our staff are on the way to the Limpsfield Road area as our safety equipment within the nearby substation has operated.

This is because every power cut increases the chance of the fault has developing to a point that our specialist teams can pinpoint it using specialist equipment. I'll let you know once our teams arrive.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have now arrived on site in the Rectory Grove area.

As any issues that currently exist on our network have affected our equipment at the substation, engineers will start their testing there. They will then check our network equipment throughout the area to try and identify any problems, before trying to restore power.

Our estimated time frame of 22:30 and 23:30 hasn't changed, but if this is not successful it's possible that a cable repair may be needed. This can involve ground excavations, traffic management equipment or specialist teams. As soon as our staff can safely update us, we'll give you the latest news. Sent by Roland at 21:05.

Sent by Donny at 19:46 - Our engineers have restored power to all 903 properties in the Uckfield TN22 5  area, and we're pleased that this is sooner than we estimated. They have diverted power around an overhead cable fault.

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations. 

We're sorry for the unplanned disruption. If you need to talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Donny at 19:28 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an overhead network fault that initially interrupted power to 903 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 238 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 22:00-23:00, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://UKPN.short.gy/STOP to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
